thread.title: PTC to Buy Vuforia business from Qualcomm
thread.title_full: PTC to Buy Vuforia business from Qualcomm

author: morningstar.com
title: PTC to Buy Vuforia business from Qualcomm
text:
By Ezequiel Minaya
Software developer PTC said Monday it has agreed to buy the Vuforia business from chipmaker Qualcomm Inc. in a deal worth $65 million.
The deal is expected to close by the end of the year and includes the developer ecosystem with over 20,000 apps, PTC said in a release.
Vuforia launched five years ago and is a mobile vision platform based on a technology called augmented reality, which involves superimposing computer-generated content over live images viewed through the cameras on mobile devices. A shopper at a furniture store, for example, could point their device's camera at a couch and get overlaid information about the designer, the price and options in style and color.
Vuforia supports multiple developer tools, including Eclipse, xCode, and Unity and runs on multiple operating systems and devices, including iOS and Android phones, tablets, and selected mobile eyewear, PTC said.
Qualcomm, the world's largest maker of chips used in mobile phones, said in July that it would conduct a sweeping strategic review that would look at the possibility of a breakup.
Write to Ezequiel Minaya at Ezequiel.Minaya@wsj.com
Subscribe to WSJ: http://online.wsj.com?mod=djnwires
 12, 2015 09:37 ET (13:37
